description:
If you're looking for freshly made moon cakes that are sublime, this is the place. I was brought up in Taiwan eating fresh grandma-made moon cakes so I have a high standard for these addicting things. It can get really annoying for other people when I am so picky about Chinese food, so I just go search out the goodies and then bring my friends to approved places. And I'm so happy to say that I found a place that makes awesome moon cakes!

Bought a box of red bean, mung bean, mixed nuts and lotus moon cakes all with yolk inside. Couldn't wait and took a bite out of the red bean then green bean cakes... oh was I in heaven! The outside layer melted in my mouth, perfectly textured, not rubbery like the imported ones. The bean pastes were done just right, not too sweet, and I can taste the flavor of the beans nicely. Looks like I'm gonna have to go back next week to grab another box. 

I also bought 5 of the bbq pork buns and they were big and warm, filled with pork and had great flavor. The buns themselves were soooo soft and yummy... so glad I don't live close by. I'd be stuffing my face with this every day!
author: Mei W.

description:
Only had their egg tarts and it's so good and comparable to Golden Gate Bakery and cheaper! Worth it!

I haven't tried anything else yet, which is the only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
This bakery is okay. Cash only! Giving it three stars because their cakes are good and fluffy which is why I like buying my cakes here. My favorite is the mango and the cakes have fruit on them so I feel very healthy buying them haha. BUT I was talked in to buying a chestnut cake last week and it wasn't all too great... I needed a smaller sized cake for a small group of friends and they only had 6in. cake in chestnut. The lady at the counter said it was good but I shouldn't have trusted her word. Next time I'm considering walking down a few blocks to Schubert's if they run out of mango cakes. 

Anyway I'm still bitter about the chestnut cake as you can tell but generally their breads are good too. The only thing that bothers me is how they try to sell you more than what you intentionally came for. It's just annoying but stand strong and don't cave in!
author: Debby N.

description:
I ordered my wedding cake here for my wedding in May 2017. The bakery might not look like much, but the workers here are very nice, accommodating, and professional. 

I came in to set up a time for cake-tasting. The master baker wasn't there, so the workers provided me with their portfolio to flip through and suggested I call back. When I came in for the cake-tasting, I was provided 6 different flavors to try from--mango mousse, coffee mousse, chocolate mousse, tiramisu, strawberry mousse, and sponge cake w/ strawberry cream filling. I loved that none of the cakes were overly sweet, perfect for me and the primarily Chinese guests at my wedding! We chose two flavors since we couldn't decide on just one :)

To book the cake, I had to place a 50% deposit plus a $100 deposit for the cake stand, which I got back after returning the cake stands, and pay the remainder of the balance one week before the wedding. I dropped off my cake topper to the bakery the same time I paid the balance. It's just one less thing for me to worry about. I text the master baker, Eddy, the design I wanted. And he did such a great job! I loved how elegant it looked and all my guests loved the cake too--both the look and the taste! Too bad I'm not getting married again or I'd order another wedding cake from here. The good news is, there are many birthdays and other celebrations to come. So if I need a cake, I'm coming here!
author: Angie Y.

description:
Extremely extremely bad customer service!!!The lady who was helping me today keeps on arguing with me just because I asked her to separate my egg custard tarts and buns into different bags because she was putting the bun on top of the tart and that's gonna smashed the tarts. She turned around and blamed me for not stating it clear enough to her from the beginning and make her re-do the work. Come on, what's so difficult to take out a tart and put it into another bag? All I can say is she is too lazy to even bother doing it for her customer, and even worst to put the blame on me. She was so persistent too in arguing with me, after a few exchanges where I can tell she is not gonna give up, I just stay quiet so that she can shut up.

Also, all the ladies at the store have the tendency to talk you into getting more stuff than you originally want to get.

Ever since this bad experience,  I have not been back to get anything for myself. There are lots of good bakeries in SF with better quality and much better service.
author: Jane A.

description:
This is currently my favorite place for pineapple buns and pork buns. There are lots of options on Clement and we have gone through and tried a bunch of them...Cherry Blossom really stands out.

The pineapple bun is so well done and flavorful without being overly sweet. The pork bun is made with good quality pork and not too much fat in the filling. I also got a green tea roll, to fill my craving for pandan chiffon cake. not quite the same but it was very good. 

I'd love to come back to try some of their cakes as well.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
My aunt brought a rolled cake from Cherry Blossom Bakery to my parents' Christmas party on Sunday, December 25th. I've been meaning to try this bakery so I was really excited when I saw their dessert.

It was a basic cream roll. The cake was moist and fluffy. The cream light and not too sweet. I'm not a huge cake person, but for some reason, this rolled cake satisfied my dessert craving. Sometimes cakes can feel really heavy (especially buttercream ones), but I loved how light this one was.

I really want to go back and try their other baked items. They all look so yummy! Thank goodness this place is in my neighborhood!
author: Elena N.

description: Everything is so fluffy and fresh out the oven. Amazing! My sister got me hooked. Please have them with your morning latte and thank me later
author: Daniela M.

description:
They get the highest rating from me of all my reviews I have written today why? Well, simple they were friendly and welcoming to a stranger in town. They listen to my order helped box it up very nicely and easily speak English and Cantonese. Nothing was hard to do here. I loved coming here to get some Chinese bakery goodies. I would recommend this place for anybody who wants some Chinese bake goodies and want some nice service. I've been to the Chinatown in San Francisco and they were not nice at the bakeries. Cherry Blossom bakery is refreshing made me feel not all Chinese people here are moody and grumpy. 

I recommend trying their, moon cakes, bbq pork buns, egg tarts and ham and egg buns.  Their ham and egg buns are made with a soft fluffy egg which is very nice. I say check this place if you haven't already especially if you plan to drive by this area. Nice people and goodies are delicious.
author: Jaci Y.

description:
My mom recommends this place for durian cakkkes!

Guys, the durian cake is no joke! My family loves and adores durian, so when we found this durian cake... we went a bit crazy and got it for everyone's birthday! The cake is usually topped off with fruits and durian is all over the cake (like in the center and on top). If you love durian, this is the plaaace to get it for the person you love or yourself... heheh. 

Their fruit cakes are good too! You have a choice of 2 types of fruit, canned fruits or fresh fruits. I like both, but I think the canned fruits one is a bit sweeter. The fresh fruits cake is more expensive too. You can choose the cake sizes by inches and it differs from flavor, size and shape. If you let them know how many you're trying to feed, they'll recommend a size to you!
author: Melanie T.

description: Their hot Hong Kong milk tea and coconut cream buns can do no wrong! We always stop by here whenever we're in the area for these. You have to try them. However, there are much better bakeries and quick dim sum shops around the area with much better egg tarts than the ones they serve here. Definitely worth a stop before you go on with the rest of your day.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Cherry Blossom is bomb. The bakery has that authentic, hole-in-the-wall vibe. Unassuming on the outside but full of cheap, delicious goodies. 

Food: Egg tarts, coconut pineapple bun, BBQ pork bun. All three were that perfect mix of moist and buttery goodness. The BBQ pork bun packed more meat than I expected (I'll refrain from dirty comments), the egg tart had that perfect custard texture, and the pineapple coconut bun had just the right amount of granulated sweetness in the middle. 

A friendly face greeted me as I surveyed the countless options. I felt welcome, always a plus when overwhelmed by pastry selection. Cash only, but not an issue when you get 4 pastries for under $5. 

I'll be back next time I'm in the Richmond. Dope!
author: Mary B.

description: They have the best egg tarts in the city. Yes, even better than Golden Gate Bakery (and much cheaper)! They pastries are all very fluffy and fresh. Their cakes are delicious, make sure you preorder though. The Vietnamese sandwiches are a mess though, skip those.
author: Anyta L.

description:
Stopped by here last week Saturday and boy am I happy we did.  I'm always willing to check-out a new bakery and my eyes and stomach were thrilled one my son and I stepped-in to gaze over the variety of buns and pastries.  It all looked really good and smelled really good too.

After looking over the display cases, we ordered the mini Baked BBQ Pork buns. Red Bean Roll, Custard Roll, Hot Dog Roll, Apple Turnover and Pineapple Strudel.  Keep in mind we just had lunch, but it smelled so good, my mouth was watering. 
Their dough is awesome.  The buns are pillowy soft and just about melt in your mouth.  The mini baked BBQ Pork buns were filled with the right amount of tasty Pork. It was all very good and I'll be back very soon.  Based upon the other Yelper reviews, there are other treats I need to try.
author: Lon H.

description: Cocktail buns and sponge cake fresh and tasty even toward the end of the day! Friendly attendants working, we barely made it in time before closing
author: Tiffani L.

description: All the pastries we bought were still hot from the oven. Most soft and fresh flakey egg tarts!
author: Grace M.

description: Went here on a Saturday morning for my pineapple bun and pork bun craving. Oh em gee... so fresh and delicious. I am buying a pink box next time. I swear that I have never eaten any bun better than what they sell here.
author: Liz A.

description:
Great neighborhood bakery with cheap, delicious pastries. I especially love the pineapple buns (crispy on the outside and so soft inside) and egg tarts! So good. They also have sponge cakes, buns, mocha rolls, green tea rolls, etc. 

There are a few tables inside to enjoy their baked goods, but I normally take them to go. The staff is also always friendly which is a plus! 

Cash only!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Great selection! We got the BBQ pastry, durian pastry, sponge cake, and much more. The hidden gem for me is the banana rice cake ( 香蕉糕）， I may have read that incorrectly.
author: Evalyn L.

description:
Found this place on accident the first time and I was pleasantly surprised! Walked in and was greeted by a very nice and friendly gentleman working there. They were almost out of cocktail buns which I had come in for, so he recommended the buttermilk bun (new favorite it's amazing!). They have a few tables and chairs for people to sit and eat, the place is very cute and clean. Food is delicious and the prices are very fair. Just make sure you bring cash because it's cash only.

We live about 45 minutes from San Francisco and don't go into the city that frequently. So the next time we came into SF we made a special trip to come back to cherry blossom bakery because I wanted to share this place with my family. Sadly I was disappointed. We were greeted gruffly by a woman who asked what we wanted. We needed some time to decide what we all wanted. She asked us 2 times if we were ready seemly rushing us and seemed annoyed like we were taking too long to decide, even tho there was no one in line behind us. As I said, we don't come into SF much, so we just wanted to take the time to look at everything they had to offer and try some new things. When we had decided she had gone to the back, so I politely called out to her to let her know we were ready to order. Waited a bit and no one responded or come to the front. We waited a bit more, and then I stepped to the side where she had walked off to see if I could see her. She was standing there organizing a tray of buns and I again politely said hi we've decided. She didn't acknowledge me or stop what she was doing. When she had finished organizing the tray she came up and said what would you like. 

It felt like we weren't customers but more a an annoyance. This experience was disappointing because there is no shortage of Asian style bakeries in SF and we had made a special trip and brought our repeat business to this specific bakery. 

Bottom line, the food is good, the prices are good. But service is inconsistent. I don't like giving my business and spending money at places that don't seem to care about their customers. Next time we'll go somewhere else.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
This place is my go-to whenever I'm in the Richmond for Asian bread! Like dim sum, Asian bread's a category with standard items, and they do it as well as any. The bread is on the denser side, but my go-to, the coconut pineapple buns, are quite soft and filled with coconut.

The owners are also really nice; when they were handing me the bread, I accidentally dropped it, and they gave me an extra piece even though it was no fault of theirs. Generally a nice mom-and-pop kind of shop too!
author: Peter X.

description:
WIFE CAKE WIFE CAKE WIFE CAKE WIFE CAKE

Other places have yummy wife cake.  This the ONLY place with Wife Cake that is flakey, buttery, YUM YUM YUM.  Get Extra, you'll need it when your SO and kids eat all you bought!

Also, the Roast BBQ Pork Buns are excellent!  As good as AA Bakery in Chinatown.

But the WIFE CAKE is the BEST I have ever had!
author: Chet M.

description:
I am usually a happy and understanding person. I did not have a pleasant experience at Cherry Blossom today. 

First time here to get some buns and tarts from them today. The lady with short hair and glasses really wanted us to order asap while we were still deciding. As we placed the order, she tried to pressure us to buy the very last tart so she could finish selling that batch. We do not want to be wasteful and spend unnecessary money on unnecessary pastry. Please don't force us to purchase your last pastry. 

When we paid, she complained that we didn't tell her sooner that we could give her the 20 cents. Come on, how come people cannot be nicer? We thought we can save you from finding change for us but you picked on us not being fast enough for you. I cannot imagine how you would treat me if I am old lady. not come to ask for your inpatience on New Year's Eve. We chose to give you business and came in happily and left your store annoyed. That is the first impression you left me, Cherry Blossom.
author: Elm E.

description: Best egg tarts on Clement St! The coconut sticks are also amazing if you're a fan of coconut.
author: Hao H.

description: Egg tarts are the best. I have been buying them here since they were $1. Now they are $1.90! These truly are the best in town though. Fluffy, eggy, sweet custard on a flaky crust. A yummy indulgence. Their cheesecake is also good I heard. I bought it for my mom's birthday, but all the guests ate it before I could. I
author: Ato Z.

description:
Called in 3 days before for a large order of pork buns, and EVEN though I called twice to confirm the order of PORK buns, guess I what I got today when I picked it up?

Hot dog buns....Hot dog somehow equals pork. Hmmm 

I said it in Chinese too, there is no way they can mistake the words CHA SIU BAO. 

I went in and specifically said I placed an order for pork buns, the lady went to check...opened the box, and from that moment she should have told me it was hot dog buns and not pork buns. But nope, she had the damn audacity to not say crap. 

You know what I'm not even mad, there was nothing I could have done since they wouldn't be able to replace that large quantity anyways. But what would I have liked? OWNERSHIP. I get it mistakes happen, but own up to your shit. They made a mistake and the least they could have done is apologize and offer a discount smh
author: Vivian S.

description: Pick up a cake for my girlfriends mothers birthday called about 20 minutes ahead of time very helpful. They made a cake with fresh fruit personalized and just how we wanted it. We saved like 10 $ and the order was all done over the phone. Will use them again
author: Brandon C.

description: Very disappointed with the bbq  pork bun.  The pork did not taste fresh, tasted like leftover pork, and the bun was not crunchy.  To me, if you're going to make baked pork bun, you need the crunch, like toast.  There's another place by 21st Avenue is much better.
author: M L.

description: I've been going to this bakery since 2012. I love there fresh baked pork buns and there fresh fruit cakes. Whenever I have a birthday or special occasion, I always order there fresh fruit cake. I love the fact that its not too sweet and you can literally eat everything on the cake. Excellent customer service especially from Mary who is the owner!
author: PremiumShotz P.

description: Good bakery w/ a nice selection of pastries and cake. You can custom order cakes - small ones can be picked up same day. Larger orders can be fulfilled in a short time if ordered in advance as well. The cakes aren't too sweet and prices aren't outrageous. My recent order of a full sheet was placed 2 days ahead. They were on time for pickup. Full sheet w/ character drawn (extra $25) was $143.
author: Julie L.

description:
Pineapple bun = perfection. Soft bun, but not just air. And not dry. (Trust me, you'll know when you've had a bad bun.) Flaky pineapple top. 

Coconut pineapple bun = epic. The aforementioned delicious pineapple bun with coconut filling is even better. 

Prices = reasonable. Two buns for $1.75.  

Service = friendly.
author: Fannie S.

description: Last year I bought 8 tins of the Durian mooncakes. So this year I received my first deliveries of this year's Durian mooncakes both for gift-giving and self-indulgence. At these prices, they were truly indulgences. But so sad to report that this year, the ones I received so far - the Durian flavor has definitely diminished, diluted due to whatever reasons i.e. high Durian prices, etc. At the premium price starting at $8 each I expected them to retain the quality. The taste was not as bright and can barely detect the durian scent like in the past. Had I not known ahead that this was Durian flavor at durian prices, I would have thought this was just a regular mooncake with a hint of durian flavoring. So what happened here?! So disappointed!!  Will start searching for better ones elsewhere in the bay areaAnybody out there who can recommend better here in the bay area, Yelp reader please send me a holler!!
author: Nancy T.

description:
best birthday cake~taste beautiful 
good Service~better price~next day pick up
fast~must going to try
author: Elaine Y.

description: I love this bakery so much! I usually get their egg tarts and red bean roll (I guess you can call it a cookie?), and they're really yummy. Their staff are so nice too; I went there in the afternoon once, only to find out that all their egg tarts were out, but the lady was nice enough to suggest that I call next time to make sure that they still have it so that I could save a trip to the bakery if they ran out.
author: Kelly N.

description: The stars are for its service. She showed me the cake when I was there to pick it up. And it started to slide off the round paper thing and thought she was going to fix it before she boxed it up for me. Then she tells me to be careful.. But this is what I end up at home...
author: Mimi H.

description:
Had a random craving for Chinese pastries & decided to pop into this little whole in the wall bakery!

 I'm so glad that I did because the egg tarts were fresh out of the oven & still steaming when we walked in. As I held the perfectly warm & golden egg tarts in my hand, I couldn't help but admire its beauty & spend a good 2 minutes taking photos of it. 
http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UAAvY3dV3XrTXwgas02ItA/l.jpg

The egg tart was made just the way I like it with the flaky outer crust and a thick layer of not-too-sweet custard center.Did I mention that the egg tarts are only 85 CENTS!?! If you like egg tarts & aren't a fan of the ridiculously long Golden Gate Bakery line, try this place!
http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/A_uMxmGPCYg2QFw-EIXwoQ/l.jpg

I also had one of their taro buns and it was also delicious. The outer layer was also flaky, the inner bread portion was soft and not too doughy, and the taro was yummy & not too sweet. I only wish they put in more taro filling and spread it out more evenly because the filling seemed to be concentrated in the very center of the bun. Regardless, for a $1 taro bun, it was delicious & definitely worth the money.
http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/TXT5pqoutenA0OShSlXeqA/l.jpg

The pork bun was OK-good but nothing special. 

Overall, definitely a solid place for Asian bakery, I liked it & I would definitely go back to satisfy future Chinese pastry cravings :)
author: June Y.

description:
Another great experience!!!!!  Two beautiful cakes for our twins' fifth birthday!!!  Everyone loved the cakes & so much praise for the excellent art work of FROZEN & CARS!!!!!  

These guys are AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!  FIVE STARS for sure!!!!!
author: mike x.

description:
90 cents egg custard tarts here are the best in Richmond and I've had all of them.

Nice thick silky egg custard with a buttery thin crust.

Also, if you catch them taking the coconut bread fresh out of the oven, eat one immediately.  That's what was recommended to us today when we purchased a dozen egg tarts.  The soft pillowy dough mixed with sweet coconut melts in your mouth while the crunchy sweet exterior gives it texture.  The coconut bread was so hot that it was steaming up the plastic bag.

Beware of how they wrap up your goods.  We were given a giant pink box that was so loosely tied that when we walked down the street, the entire box fell apart!  We almost lost everything on the sidewalk but luckily the box landed on the ground with the lid closed so our custard tarts were safe but smashed.
author: Lorissa W.

description: Cherry Blossom Bakery is a lovely neighborhood bakery that's tasty and inexpensive. I often stop here on afternoon strolls around the neighborhood. Their egg tarts and BBQ chicken buns are my favorite. I wish they had a few more veggie options.
author: Rae B.

description: First & foremost, they have a wide selection and many items are pretty good.  I give this place 1-star because they like to bait-switch you.  I bought a few of my favorite buttermilk buns and was told by lady in glasses if I get 2 more, she will give me 2 other buns for free.  She ended up giving me 1 free.  I asked her I thought you said 2, she replies you wanna get something else for another free bun.  At this point, I just gave her the ok, you got me look.  Then upon paying, I asked her since you didn't give me the 2nd free bun, can you give me a bag at least to put in the stuff I bought.  Answer:  I'll give you a bag if you buy over $10.  Moral of this review, it's all about the principal and apparently, the lady I dealt with has none.  Please don't give false promises to entice customer to buy more items.  I rather pay for the items then be taken for as a fool! (you ain't gonna get me twice)
author: Jocylyn P.

description: I have only bought the cocktail coconut buns here.  Based on a good review I decided to buy one and was disappointed by the very small size for the price of $0.85. The bun itself was okay. You get much better value and more coconut filling in buns sold in China town at Wong Lee Bakery on Jackson street between Grant and Stockton.
author: Charmaine L.

description: I just ordered a cake for my wedding shower at this location and everyone loved it! cake was so airy and the mango filling was delicious.
author: czarina l.

description:
I've FINALLY found a Chinese bakery worth going to! Despite having lived here for a couple of years, I never found a suitable place to get char siu bao (BBQ pork bun) until Cherry Blossom Bakery. Most other places either have bad filling (too sweet) or bad bread (too dense, too doughy). The BBQ pork bun here, however, is a great balance and definitely worth the money.

Other highlights from here include the egg custard tart. Really nice, flaky crust and perfectly cooked custard.

I've been here multiple times and it has remained consistent. Try to get here early in the day to get things fresh. Also, unlike some other SF "bakeries", this place opens early and has all of their pastries ready to go.
author: Michael W.

description:
Wow. Rude.

I got yelled at for not ordering fast enough. She was like the soup Nazi. In her defense the pastries were super cheap but I left feeling violated :(
author: Carolina Z.

description: I LOVE all their buns and cakes!!! Pineapple bun, cocktail bun,  egg tart......  EVERYTHING is Gooood!!  It is Always Fresh. They never disappoint me. I get all my cakes from them and it is always good!
author: G M. C.

description: I love this place.  I love the fact that you can get mini pork and hot dog buns as well as fresh piping hot egg custard tarts (dan tat).   This place is great and am so glad it's in the neighborhood.
author: Edgar C.

description: I only go here for their mini hot dogs. My kids love them and at least this and their regular size hot dog buns don't have any sesame seeds on top. I've found other places that have that and my kids don't like that.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I stopped by here after looking up places that had good egg tarts. This was right on Clement and highly recommended!

The egg tarts were about 90 cents each, fluffy with a good amount of egg custard filling and best of all, they were STILL WARM! The other pastries looked equally delicious and included; mini mouse cakes, pineapple custard buns, swiss rolls and hot dog buns.

 I can't wait to try the rest next time!
author: Petra S.

description:
We had dan ta, pineapple custard bun & flower cake. Having just come out of the oven, the dan ta was warm & gooey - but in all honesty, had it not been warm, it would have been an average dan ta.  The pineapple custard buns were quite delicious - not overly sweet & a good pineapple topping, custard filling, and bread ratio.  Flower cake was tasty & moist inside.  Did not have any problems with the service that others have complained about.  The girl behind the counter was friendly and seemed quite eager to take our order.

3.5 stars for the pastries
4 stars for the prices - better than chinatown!
3 stars for the service
author: Catherine A.

description: I was brave and tried their Durian cake because I was curious about it. I knew it would stink because I tried Durian ice cream from Polly Ann, so I was prepared somewhat. So I got a cake that fed 4 people that costs about $23. I was impressed with what it looked like because it was pretty looking and looked like a normal cake. it was very light texture cake that doesn't weigh you down like typical  American cakes would. The durian fruit is on the bottom of the cake and is yellow. Texture reminds me of a mango sort of I guess with some resistance to it? Hard to describe.  Yes, it did stink and you have to make sure you close the kid of the box tight or the smell will permeate throughout your fridge and in the room. LOL All in all it was an interesting and enjoyable experience. another foodie experience to cross off my bucket list! oh I did buy a hog dog bun and it was really good and fresh tasting. The dough was so soft. If you have a sweet tooth, you may enjoy the coconut bun. Next time I will try the pineapple custard bun and the egg tart and what other yelpers recommend. Nice bakery all in all.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Cherry Blossom Bakery is small with only a few tables. nevertheless, they have a lot of foot traffic. bakery items mostly baked, don't know where the steamed buns were. maybe sold out

eats:
-bbq pork bun(1)
doughy bun with cubed bbq pork inside, not so tender nor juicy
-scallion bun(1)
sweet tasting, dougy bun. with green onions, 

crumbs:
-pastries look tantalyzing, tasty here
-don't know what's really good here
-items tried were avove average, good value
-just right for breakfast.
author: Victor G.

description:
Ah, Cherry Blossom Bakery. I really didn't think that my white boyfriend would know what made a good Asian bakery, but the man knows his pastries, and this place is no exception.

It's exactly what an Asian bakery should be: super cheap, highly delicious, and a danger zone for bakery fiends like me, meaning I will probably definitely buy one of each thing in the display case.

I desperately need to figure out when they get their cream cheese buns in, because those things are fantastic. They will let you know when the cocktail buns are fresh, and they are sooooo worth it. Also, I needed a last-minute cake for father's day last week...and I was able to get a full round tiramisu cake with writing on it for the low low price of about $22. And I didn't have to pre-order. It's just something they happened to have in stock at about 4pm and that is amazing considering I don't actually know when they close.

This place is cash-only, so be sure to visit an ATM on the way. $5 will get you all the things you really need in life when you go to Cherry Blossom Bakery: two cocktail buns, a walnut cookie, a cream cheese bun, and a slice of walnut pound cake. (Actually, that came out to $4.) You won't see the pineapple bun in the display case, usually, but you should absolutely make sure to get some, especially if they're fresh. Basically, point to anything that looks good to you and just get it. It's way more bang for your buck than that bland $3 scone you were about to buy at Starbucks, mmk.
author: Robbin A.

description:
This tiny bakery offers up delicious pastries at unbelievably cheap prices. 

Sponge cakes, scallion buns, tiny sandwiches, custard desserts, and many other tasty options. 

My faves include the little egg custard tarts and the red bean rolls with sesame. Yum yum!

You can literally order a bunch of pastries here for under 5 bucks. What a deal!

Fast and friendly service. With indoor seating available, you can also enjoy your baked goodies right inside the shop.
author: Ann S.

description:
This review is for the custard tarts.  It has a nice flakey crust.  The custard was silky however, it was very bland.  

I was so hopeful.   Still looking to find a bakery, NOT in Chinatown for them.
author: Debbie T.

description:
This bakery is ok. I got some Chinese pastries and they were ok. 

The place doesn't stand out from any other Chinese bakery. 

A pineapple bun is a pineapple bun and an egg tart is an egg tart right?
author: Gangsta G.

description: Chicken curry buns slimy. You pass by and you see customer while  eating their pastries and sipping their coffee  trying to kill the bugs on the window. Lady owner only nice to certain customers  who will buy a lot.  Their bakery goods really went downhill.  Not clean if they have bugs flying by the window!
author: C B.

description:
We've gotten several kiddie birthday cakes from here. The price is always reasonable for a giant cake.  We usually get a full sheet.  The head baker always draws/decorates whatever/however I imagine the cake should be for a small additional fee.  At party end, friends are always asking to get some cake to take home.  It's always a winner.

Aside from custom cakes, we practically come here EVERY Saturday. My boys love the paper wrapped sponge cakes and the baked pork buns.  We can't get enough.  My fav is the shredded pork bun.  Although... I probably won't turn down anything from here.  

Side confession: A girlfriend and I have finished a full sized angel food cake between the two of us.  This is my go to Chinese bakery.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
Possibly my new favorite bakery in the city.

I ordered one sesame red bean bao ($0.90) and one coconut bao ($0.90). The lady behind the counter was nice enough to heat up the baos for me - without me having to ask. So sweet! The prices are pretty much standard nowadays but the taste was anything but standard. The red bean paste was top notch. In other words, it was SUPER FRESH - rumors has it that they make their own red bean paste! The coconut bao was tasty, too. It had an equal ratio of bao to coconut paste. I will definitely be back to buy a box of baos.
author: Annie S.

description:
I have a confession to make- I bought the last 2 durian moon cakes of the season in SF. Yes, this is the only bakery in SF that sells durian moon cakes. And yes, I got their card to special order some in the foreseeable future. And no, I won't share. 

Their durian moon cake is like a creamy custardy delight. It consist of a lard filled shell, small amounts of lotus paste, and lots of yellow durian. And sometimes, it may come with a big bright yellow yolk. However, for my own personal preferences, I prefer it without the yolk. 

I will be back next year (or even sooner).
author: Mabel Y.

description:
This is my favorite Chinese bakery in all of San Francisco.  In fact, this is also the cleanest Chinese bakery I've ever stepped into as well.  I come here for the whole wheat raisin bread and their mini pineapple buns with custard.  Whenever I stop by, it is usually around noon, so the buns are always warm and fresh out of the oven.  The bun itself is so soft.  Each bite is addictive.  I usually come in here with the intention of buying the whole wheat raisin bread, but end up leaving with a bag full of other goodies.

Whole wheat raisin bread: 2 for $1.20
Mini pineapple buns filled with custard: 3 for $1.25 (Keep in mind pineapple is not an ingredient of this bun.  I honestly do not know where the name came from.)

Quick tip: They are also well known for their dried pork bun, Vietnamese sandwich, and egg tarts.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
Yum! I love Chinese bakeries. I got some pineapple buns, cha xiu bao, onion bun. All for under $2. The price is very decent and tastes very wonderful. I didn't get any egg tars and they were as cheap as other places. 

I would love to come here all the time if I lived in the city. Great place and highly recommended.
author: Cindy K.

description:
zee bow dan go: paper-wrapped sponge cake

PERFECTLY DONE 85 cents for happiness.. small price to pay
author: Jana C.

description:
The good:
cocktail buns that just came out of the oven

the bad: 
egg tart wasn't all it was cracked up to be (pun intended)

There were a bunch of things that looked good so I'll be back to give the dan tat another try.  Looks like they do well with cakes too.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Delicious food. The egg tarts are really good here.  Everything is freshly baked and the service is great. Only con is it's cash only like most of bakeries around here. Other than that everything was good.
author: Ann L.

description:
This place. Smells. Like sweetness.

Just baked. Cake. And light. Delights.

Fluffy looking pastries. Custard filled tasties.

Limited on dough?  Just go for the chewy, miniature oatmeal cookie dealio.

Just the right size. Perfect sugar high.

Soooooo good.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I love the buns they have.  The chicken buns are fantastic!  Positively stuffed with flavorful chicken and sometimes mushrooms too.  I am also addicted to the coconut rolls and their egg custard tarts.  And cheap?  You betcha.

I don't speak any Cantonese, and the counter lady didn't have much English, but we managed just fine with pointing.  She was really nice and didn't have a problem with my  indecisiveness.   Surprised to see bad service mentioned in so many reviews.
author: .Hon H.

description: We love their baked goods and go there a few times every week, so we wanted them to make our wedding cake.  They had a large selection of cakes and designs for our cake.  We decided to mix the types with mango mousse and tiramisu on different layers.  The cake was gorgeous  (see the photo we posted) and everybody loved it!  Very reasonable price also.
author: H B.

description:
After years of not having cake for birthdays, I finally broke the hiatus when I found out about Cherry Blossom Bakery!

My dad loves mango and when I heard about their mango cake, I knew my dad would be just as excited for his birthday dinner. The cake was $23 and was enough to feed 8 people with big slices and still enough left over. I would say that it feeds about 10-12 people. They also have a mango mousse cake ($20) which I was skeptical about, because I wasn't completely sure how they would react to the mousse. 

The lady over the phone was helpful and she alone deserves her own star. 

The bakery also offers mini buns and I can't wait to go back to try the pineapple custard buns!
author: Connie C.

description:
Cherry Blossom's tucked away at the end of the Clement "Asian Food Galore" corridor...but it's close to my apartment and I love it. My criteria for a good Chinese bakery is pretty simple: good cha siu bao (BBQ Pork Bun), good daan taats (Egg Tarts) and good HK Style Milk Tea. 

BBQ Pork Buns: Solid. It's not the baked BBQ pork buns at Hong Kong Lounge but then again, this isn't a dim sum place. Perfect bread to BBQ pork ratio. I'm always getting these for the office on Fridays and everyone loves them (and me). 

Egg Tarts: Solid. Flaky crust with not-too-sweet egg custard in the middle. Perfect when it's fresh out of the oven. The ladies there always let me know when the egg tarts are fresh and I can never resist getting one, two...or six.

HK Style Milk Tea: Solid. Seriously made-to-order...so you might have to wait a little bit while they concoct the milk tea in the back, but totally worth it. Made with real black tea ("Red tea" in literal translation in Chinese) and condensed milk. Delish.

On service, I'm always buying more pastries than I can eat because they always call me "laang jai." Considering the price, quality and service...I'M SOLD!
author: Jeremy F.

description: Tried the scallion bread, curry bun, sponge cake, and BBQ pork bun. Nothing really stood out to me, except for the BBQ pork bun! It had the perfect meat to bun ratio, and I prob could eat like five at once... The bread is super soft and light and took me back to my childhood! Def would recommend the pork buns!
author: Sarah S.

description: Egg tarts and custard buns are the BEST! First time coming here and I'm very satisfied!!!!
author: Sandy C.

description:
Here, they have the standard chinese buns such as, baked bbq pork, green onion, coconut bun, pineapple bun (some are filled with taro, red bean...). I just wish that they had some still in their warming cabinet. But I do enjoy their egg custard tarts, especially when they just tell me that they just came out of the oven! oooohhhh

Staff is nice and helpful too.

But my favorite reasonto come here is to get my Hong Kong Milk tea fix. It also doesn't hurt that it's a hop, skip and a jump from where I live!
author: Heidi L.

description: Today is my sister's birthday and we decided to buy a cake from this bakery to try it out. The appearance of the cake was really nice but we were really disappointed by the quality of the cake. The cream of the cake tasted like sour cream since it was not freshly made. The outside of the cake had a layer of cookies that was stale, making it very difficult to eat. The lady at the counter even said that the cake was supposedly fresh but it turns out that she was lying to us.
author: Ruby F.

description: Ordered taro cake for my bday. It's not sweet with just the natural taro sweetness. On top there is chestnut purée and it was really good. The sponge cake itself is like the Taiwanese cheesecake , not the American one.  Not sure if you try the honey cheese cake pack from ranch 99, that's how it tastes like.
author: Ashley C.

description: Cheap and descent.  Not the greatest service but my cake came on time and I pick it up without hassle.
author: Kat H.

description: Recently went back to one of my favorite bakeries this time... I had myself some Onion Buns & Chicken Pies although the chicken pies maybe a little expensive... Who cares about the price if it comes to a point if your really really hungry and dont come here to often to buy the chicken pies from the Cherry Blossom Bakery for me... I would always buy the chicken pies from this bakery its because they make it pretty good!!!
author: William B.

description:
My family ordered 4 durian cakes over the weekend to celebrate the New Year. FOUR! Even they were shocked, but seriously, that's how good their durian cakes are.

We also bought a bunch of side pastries for only $6. Ridiculously cheap & ridiculously delicious.
author: V L.

description:
BEST egg custard egg tarts in SF!!!

I love eating them when they're still warm and fresh from the oven. It's so tasty. The crust is nice and flaky and the custard is smooth and lightly sweet.  Only $0.75 each. 

I also tried the pineapple coconut bun which is good too. But I'm here mainly for the tarts.
author: Tes Y.

description:
Last weekend, the hunt was on for a custard bun.  Not the steamed kind with the white exterior and the yolky interior.  Also not the "pineapple" crusted baked bun.  I was looking for a very specific "nai-wang-bao" that was oblong-shaped, baked, and had a large circular pattern drawn on top of the shiny golden brown dome.  I knew this thing existed because I had seen it before!  But previous attempts to actualize this bun in various shops along Clement street met with unfortunate quantities of "pineapple" topped custard buns or steamed custard buns.  

Also, I'd seen it in Sheng Kee Bakery for about $1.10.  

On the last day of last year, I bravely walked past Good Luck Dim Sum and kept on walking.  Past that crazy clothing store "Get Thee To The Nunnery."  And wandered in here.  

I saw some small buns that looked like it could be the custard bun.  Upon inquiry, the lady told me they were "Mexican buns" and did not contain anything.  

But then.

In the case.

The golden domed top.

The swirl pattern.

The oblong shape.

And, of course, the sign: "Custard Bun"  

FINALLY.  My rudimentary recognition of Chinese characters confirmed that I was calling it the correct name.  My Chinese recognition software in my head is like face recognition software.  It matches patterns without actually "reading."  Heh.  

The cost was $0.80.  I got 1.  And I ate it in the dark.  By my self.  In the closet.  Covered in my shame.  But it was so good.  The bread part did not intimidate the custard part.  There was a good proportion of both.  Each bite had some bread and some custard.  

The next day I got 3.

I was so desperate to find this bun that I was going to either stop eating all inferior imitations or make it myself.  Luckily for my oven, my family and my stomach, I won't have to attempt to make Asian Bread.  Because what the eff is that cooked paste thing they start with?  I ended up making glue.
author: Christina C.

description:
Cherry Blossom Bakery - sounds like it is a Japanese bakery but in reality it's a Chinese bakery.  I didn't see the mini cupcakes that they sometimes carry but the other minis were so cute (e.g., mini hot dog buns, mini BBQ pork buns).  They have a wide variety of baked Chinese buns (no steamed ones) including chicken mushroom, green bean, red bean sesame twist, hot dog, BBQ pork, curry beef, cheese, chicken cheese and more.  Full size buns are 80 to 95 cents (not bad).  The buns look big, lightly golden and glossy in the case.

They also have full size and individual size cakes, loaf bread, and pastries but I spent my time looking at the buns.  I selected my buns and the girl behind the counter told me a tray of egg custard tarts was fresh out of the oven, so I added one tart my order as well.  

The buns are decent but soft and doughy as Rita Y. points out.  Also some of the buns feel light because there isn't much filling.  

* Egg custard tart:  It was very hot!  These are big, Hong Kong style tarts with flaky thin layers of puff pastry surrounding a tender, eggy, slightly sweetened custard.  Pretty good though I'd prefer a sweeter crust, perhaps more buttery.
* Chicken cheese bun: A rather odd bun featuring a breaded chicken patty dotted with a tiny dab of ketchup; the cheese is on the outside of the bun.   
* Curry beef bun:  The yellow curry with ground beef was good but there was so little filling inside.
* Red bean sesame bun: Barely any red bean!  Pass.

They serve coffee and tea, plus they sell cold drinks like soy milk.  I was surprised not to see any Chinese seniors sitting there - not a good sign?
author: Lolia S.

description: My favorite Chinese bakery to pick up cheap pastries near work. Custard buns, red bean buns, and my favorite, warm cocktail buns straight from the oven. At $0.65 per piece, you might want to rethink about where you get your breakfast.
author: Auburn S.

description:
I have been described, charitably, as the whitest man alive. I didn't pick my parents, so I don't have a lot of flexibility on skin tone. That's just skin deep. The rest of me loves the food and people from all the cultures that have gathered in this amazing city.

With that grain of salt spicing my review, when it comes to recommending a Chinese bakery, what do I know?  I know from tasty... I have no idea if the baked goods here are authenticly Chinese, but I do know they are good, and sold by nice folks.

This is a really great spot. Their bbq pork buns are great, dried pork buns are excellent. The don tot (egg custard tarts) are eggy, flaky and delicious. The mini sized bao are perfect for potlucks and school events and much loved by small kids.  All of the rest of the pasty line up is good -- and well received by all eaters in my house. 

My children are learning Cantonese and the folks here are super patient with our ordering. The older folks having coffee here whenever we visit love to chat and hear how my (equally pale) children came to know Cantonese. This bakery came recommended by parents at SFUSD's Chinese Immersion School at DeAvila.
author: Charlie G.

description: I love their mango cake with fresh mango slice on the outside and inside.  So fresh!  It's not too sweet.
author: Helen L.

description:
How can I rate the place when 3 times I walked in and 3 times I walked out because of the level of service....
I was waiting in line when an old lady was trying to get help from the counter service person, while she is trying to get an opinion, the girl was busy texting on her phone and shooting meaningless answers to the customer.

This was the case in the last time I walked in there, and twice before I walked in and out for similar reasons.

this is a new level of bad service!

No reason to waist my time on this review and add more details. 
One thing is sure, I am never giving them my money.
author: David V.

description: I'm was cheating on Clement Restaurant/Bakery by popping into here. Clement Restaurant has been my go-to place in the Richmond District. I tried a nai wong bolo bau and a dan tat. Both were great. I walked out impressed with this place. I guess I'll have to spread my love around hehe.
author: Derek N.

description:
- Good HK milk tea; not too sweet, tea is almost always fresh brewed, and just the right amount of milk.

- Selection of mini-buns (currently 3 for $1.25) means you can try a little bit of everything

- From my data points of frequent visits, fresh buns come out ~9:15am

- Enough seating for about a dozen people.  Even when they're busy, it doesn't feel hectic, and they don't yell at you.  (What some may perceive as "yelling at you" is normal Cantonese people speaking loudly and clearly and quickly so let's get this line moving, eh?  Try Good Luck Dim Sum - now THEY are yelling.)
author: Kayan W.

description:
I would say the pastries are about a 3.5. I give it a 4 because the ladies speak english and are pretty nice(my chinese is horrible).  I bought the mini custard and mini red bean pineapple buns for my work and a raisin bun for myself. I think the crust is too sweet for me, it overpowered the custard bun. The red bean bun was reallly good, probably because the red bean is really thick and sweet and balances out the crunchy sweet top. My raisin bun was disappointing, hardly any raisins. The bread was very light and airy, but I think it needed a bit more vanilla. 
I do miss the days when these minis would go 4 for a $1. They were 3 for $1.10, but I guess you can't do anything about inflation.
author: Caroline C.

description: I just took my boys here yesterday and we tried a variety of the baked goods and my kids loved it. They really like the hot dog stuffed inside a bun. The mocha cake was also delicious. And the egg custard dessert was very good. We have tried it at many places and I can honestly say that the egg custard here was one of the best. We tried a lot of the different items here and everything was great. We are definitely making a stop at this bakery every time we are in the city for sure.
author: Tammy M.

description:
This place has the most terrible service!

Our family of four,  with 2 preteen boys, were going to a ball game with their friends where they will get dirty and sweaty. We came this place to order over 2 dozen different pastries and asked the cashier/server to put everything in each individual bags. 

She tried to put everything in one box so we said we need each pastry in an individual bags because we are going to a ball game and we will get dirty with no way of washing our hands. Then she tried to put 2 pastries in each bag and we told her that's not going to work. We said we wanted to hold the pastries in the bag while we eat.

We asked her again to do that, which she did. However when she totaled our receipt, she added 20 cents to our already $50+ of purchase. (Not that we didn't want to pay this measly 20 cents but this is a sleazy way of doing business.) She didn't mentioned she would charge for the bags. It is not like she is giving us a discount on quantity purchase...we paid(or were going to pay) full price anyway.

 So if every customer that comes in to buy 1 pastry at a time, are they going to  ask them to wait for the next customer so they can put both their pastries in one bag? WHAT IS THE DIFFERENCE WHEN YOU SELL ONE PASTRY TO ONE CUSTOMER....YOU STILL USE ONE BAG AT A TIME!!!

We got so frustrated, because this is not the first time this happened, we told her to put all of the pastries back because we are going down the street to buy from another place. We notice that when we walked out they put everything back and THEN SHE DROPPED ONE OF THE BUNS. She picked it up and instead of throwing away in the trash can next to her, she took it to the back. We know she wasn't going to waste that bun, so we ask her what she is going to do with that bun she just picked up. She said she is going to "throw it away in the back". We said the trash can is right there next to her but she continued to the back. We just feel sorry for the next customer who would be unlucky enough to buy that dropped bun.

We can't believe how stupid a business is willing to go to loose a sale over some measly little bags. We have been their customers ever since they took over "Napoleon Bakery" a couple of years ago. We have bought pastries from them every few weeks or so.....NOT ANYMORE! I work at a large supermarket near them so I will do my best to steer all potential customers away. 

The next time I go back there I will were a surveillance camera to capture their acts. Stay tuned......
author: Derek N.

description: After wedding cake tasting at several places for a cream cake, rather than traditional fondant, we stumbled upon this quaint bakery. We were blown away by their freshness and price. We went with a 3-tier cake with another sheet, which served about 400. Delicious! Sweetened just right! Gone by the end of the night. Since then, we've been coming back for cakes for birthdays and special occasion.
author: Dr T.

description: Now that kings is closed I had to find a new cocoanut bun place and the cocktail bun here is just as good if not better than kings. So glad I found it. The other things I tried were great too!
author: Taylor J.

description: HK TEA is really good, one of the top 5 in the city. I have liked every pastry I've had there so far, the onion bun, wheat raisin bun, sesame bun, they're all great.
author: James P.

description:
So I was going to review this place after only eating their supremely cheap cookies and pastries.  As I was about to begin my masterful strokes (of the keyboard) I read some other reviews of this joint.  They all raved about the buns.

I decided I needed some buns in my mouth before I could give a proper feel of this joint.  Guess what?  The buns are incredible...AND helllllza cheap.  I am totes going there tomorrow for breakfast, possibly lunch, but most likely not dinner.
author: Pouria Y.

description: This place use to have great tasting egg custard tarts, but now the custard tarts are just OK tasting. They also got rid of certain items that I use to order. The mini butterfly cookies here don't taste as good as the ones at Sheng Kei, It's a shame the flavor of the baked goods has declined so much since my last visit.
author: Mike W.

description: I come here for the mini custard pineapple buns. Soooo good. 3 for less than $2.
author: Cupcake s.

description:
they've got gigantic croissants, i've never tried it but my picky eater granny approves. egg custards on a metal warmer so they'll always taste oven fresh. not to mention all your typical chinese bakery goodies like cocktail buns, pineapple buns, pound cakes, moon cakes, you name it. very good addition to clement st.
btw, don't be offended by the glaring stares from them chinese grandpas enjoying their morning cup of coffee, they don't bite...they're just nosy.
author: Melissa Y.

description: yuummmyy and the best part is that I can pick this cake up anytime. They have a great staff that really knows their stuff. This is my new go to place for bday cakes to my staff. I've only tried the mango moose, I'm gonna try the strawberry one next!
author: rachel w.

description: I ordered a durian cake for my mom's birthday and it was delicious!!!!!  Everything was fresh and the price is reasonable.  I ordered an 8 inch, which serves about 10 people and it cost $23.  I deducted one star because I went there a few times in the morning and all their pastries are cold (not even warm)....just cold.  I guess I'm a little picky, but I like my buns hot.
author: Melissa T.

description: This place is amazing and going to make me gain 100 lbs. I bought breakfast this morning for my entire team at work (5 people), and it totaled $3.90. What?! My favorite is the red bean sesame bun. The pineapple coconut bun is also delicious. Actually, everything is delicious there, so far.
author: Pema L.

description: stopped here for egg tarts and pork buns. Needless to say, they were delicious and cheap. was a little crowded... but what do you expect when they have such low prices.
author: Samantha H.

description: My best go to bakery right now. The sesame bun, pineapple bun, and Mexican bun are my favorites.
author: Mary L.

description: I bought a chocolate cream roll and it was the best!  Very chocolately - more dark chocolate than milk.  Cream was just right.  Now if only they will make this version of the chocolate cake for the birthday cakes - I would definitely buy that!
author: Wendy H.

description: I always got the HK milk tea here. It's so good and warm on a cold day. Though it depends on who is making it at the counter. One lady (the shorter one of the two) makes it just right while the other makes it so watery. The buns are good and really cheap, I would get the onion bun with my milk tea. It's a good bakery overall.
author: Estela K.

description:
I love that place and so do my hubby and my kids.  We used to buy bread from Napolean because of the low price and okay quality.  After it changed to Cheery Blossom, we feel the real improvement of the cakes.  There're so many varieties.  So far, we have tried the following cakes: -

1) Mango Moouse which is the best one there; a lot of mango (though sometimes the one on the outside seem dry), moist and just the right sweetness.

2) Princess Cake which is a bit too sweet for the almond paste but it is really pretty; it's my birthday cake that my hubby bought me.  The cake was pink and I have received so much compliment on the appearance.

3) Chocolate Moouse Cake offers a good portion of chocolate flavor, not too heavy, not too light.  Even my parents who don't really like chocolate like it.

4) Tiramisu is not too outstanding but also good in taste.

5) Fruit cake contains a lot of fruits and it's really tasty.

This bakery recently raised quite a bit on their breads, 10%+ but it's still not too expensive as compared to other bakeries in the same area.  They also introduced mini versions lately such as mini hot dogs, mini cupcakes... My son loves the mini cupcakes and min cakes which he can finish one on his own.  He feels happy that he needs not to share with his sister, haha...
author: Roserrele W.

description:
Their specials - such as three Lao Po Bing for a dollar - are definitely a good value for your money. I also like their other baked buns and pastries - buttery, oily, sugary - the way a Chinese baked good should be. The egg tart is definitely solid. 

Biggest plus though, is their cleanliness. I'd get a cup of coffee and enjoy a chapter of a novel here.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Stopped by here while I was waiting for the bus. Small bakery, but friendly workers. 
All I remember is that they have really yummy coconut sticks. I think it was around $2
Thats all I can speak for.
author: Salem T.

description: They have the best egg custard in SF! And their buns are delicious too!!
author: J C.

description: Great quality baked goods. Even after three days, bread is still fresh especially if u can reheat it with a toaster. I prefer this over Shengkee or any other chain bakeries. Their egg tarts are just as good as Golden Gate in Chinatown, plus they're cheaper! Too bad I don't live close by enough to go often.
author: R A.

description: MMmmmmmm Apple turnover mmmmmmmmm
author: Dana S.

description: Recently had the mango mousse cake and apple pie. Really enjoyed both but preferred the pie. The cake was light like most asian style cakes and the mousse was tasty. The pie had a nice flaky crust and the apples inside were soft but not mushy.
author: chibi i.

description:
holy holy!  go here if you want to get a rad jammin asian style dessert!  now now!  it is so cheap and quality and cute and fresh!  go now before they are either discovered or go out of business because their prices are too low for them to make any profit.  
they have full size fruit custard cakes, other fruit cakes, roll cakes, all the usual asian bakery items, and what i go for-
the cute yummy ass mini cakes!!!
tiramisu, mango, strawberry mousse, chocolate ganache, cheesecake, wowy wow wow!  they also have asian style white bread, bbq pork buns, coconut buns and loafs.
the art they put into even the lil mini cakes deserves more than 2.25$ a pop.  so i like to tip extra.  
thanks for reading!
author: yayoi s.

description: yummy durian cake!! generous portion of durian in the cake.
author: Hanh L.

description: I adore this place. It isn't just the little buns that I have a penchant for...it's the overall serenity of the shop that I truly appreciate. That sounds somewhat silly but Clement can get hectic and it's a fragrant, tranquil refuge that is so comforting. I don't know what it is - every time I go in there the people are sweet as can be and it's nice and quiet and it smells so good - I just want to start bringing a blanky with me and hang out for awhile. That being said, this is a great place to come if you are hungover, starving and broke. Three bucks and you're Cherry Blossom Bakery rich. My favorites so far are the not so adventurous ham and cheese bun, the mini pork buns (great snacks for your friends too), and the scallion bun. I'm also a fan of their juice box assortment.
author: Kathy K.

description: This review is strictly for Cherry Blossom's dan tats.  The best egg tarts in the Richmond and probably just behind Golden Gate Bakery!  ALWAYS fresh egg tarts, hot, gooey, runny, and flakey crusts.  Unlike most Chinese bakeries where the ladies behind the counter seem to be in a constant hurry (I mean.. come on, half of your frequent customers are 60+ year old seniors who just want their bao and coffee. Have some patience!).  Anyway, I digress... the ladies who work here are really nice and patient -- such a refreshing contrast compared to the other bakeries in the area.
author: Ray C.

description: Right around the corner from my house, crazy cheap, and very tasty. I tried at least one of everything and always loved it. I ordered a cake from here once and my whole family was impressed. We obliterated it.
author: Laura M.

description: Great mini cakes and very affordable. My fav is their mango mousse or chocolate mousse cakes.  Definitely worth the calories!!!
author: J. K.

description: I love this place. Its cute. Their food is good and cheap. I get a warm feeling about this place that makes me want this place to be my home. I hope white hipster yuppies don't invade it and if they do I hope they shut up and die. I recommend the chicken mushroom buns and sponge cake.
author: AJ C.

description: Service is lacking. Food is okay, but you may need to pop a bun in the microwave because they don't taste awesome at room temp
author: k h.

description: One of the few places that sell durian cake. You need to call and order in beforehand if you want one. The bakery selection was decent.
author: Leo C.

description: I come to buy the mini custard pineapple buns: 3 for $1.15. Their mini custard pineapple buns ARE way better than Red A over by 8th.  Their mini bbq buns are famous too, but I just buy my custard pineapple buns. Their milk tea? For a long time, the construction of the cup was off...as I would walk down the street with cup in hand, it would leak. That turned me off since it got so freaking messy. The last several times have been better, no more leakage. The tea they use is more fragrant than most places, so the flavor is more well rounded.
author: Annie Y.

description: Ok - 1 bonus star for the lady saying "What you want???" but it was funny. I love the paper sponge cakes here- and the prices here are so cheap you wonder how they could be so cheap.
author: John S.

description:
This bakery has great egg tarts, and everything is pretty much the cheapest of all the places I go to in the city. I especially love the egg tarts and the paper cakes, but the buns are pretty good too.

Another thing I like about this bakery is that the buns aren't as 'lardy' as those you find at other bakeries. You don't feel as stuffed after having them. They do taste a little more dry, but it's much better for you that way.
author: Barn M.

description: Service has improved with the new management (used to be Napoleon).  It tastes like they perhaps have kept the same baker because the goods are very similar.  This has become my favorite Chinese bakery in the Richmond area because every time I walk in, I am greeted by the wonderful aroma of fresh baked, and everything is still warm to the touch.  I have not tried any of their cakes, but the classics are all very good- Hot Dog buns, BBQ Pork buns, Pineapple buns, Egg Tarts, etc.  And like ABC Bakery, they also offer a selection of mini's- perfect for kids or when you want a sampling of different items.
author: Judy K.

description:
ew
can you say gross?
what's up with the high ratings
cakes looked nice from behind the display case
so ordered the strawberry shortcake and green tea mousse cake
they were gross 
it was just whipped cream didn't even taste like green tea
ahh. so disappointed
just wanted to finish lunch with a nice dessert
author: Candy Y.

description:
i got their mini custard pineapple buns, and it's really good.  i've been to many places to get these, and this is by far the best one.  their "pineapple" top is nice and crunchy and has a nice... almond(?) hint to it.  their custard is okay (not the best that i have had...), but it was nicely (and evenly) distributed throughout the bun.

i also bough an entire mango mousse cake from here. it was not what i had expected at all.  i was expecting.. more cake?  the entire thing is cream with one (1/4") layer of cake at the bottom and in between.  so there was only 1/2" of cake out of the 4" high cake; the rest was cream.  it's not a mousse consistency and didn't taste much like mango... just tasted like whipped cream.  there is a yellow gel layer at the top, which i guess is supposed to taste like mango, but it doesn'.  so the cake was a real bummer for me.  i guess it's still good, except it doesn't taste like mango, and i wanted more cake to it.
author: H. L.

description:
I tried to like this place.  It used to be a small Chinese deli (chow mein, chow fun, take-out food, etc) but now it's a quaint little Chinese bakery.  The 2 young female employees were really friendly & bilingual.  I bought 4 items to try:  Curry beef pie, coconut bun, baked BBQ pork bun and scallion/pork bun.  
I was disappointed by all 4.  The curry beef pie had a mushy filliing and you could barely taste any meat but the curry flavor was good.  The outer pastry wasn't flaky enough for me. I still think Alex's Bakery, further East on Clement makes better curry beef pies with a great flaky crust.
The coconut bun was OK, but you'd be better off buying it from Sunset Bakery on 9th/Judah.  The BBQ pork filling was OK, but for some reason the dough is consistently bad for all their baked products.  It's soft, mushy and doughy tasting.  I didn't care for the scallion/pork bun either (it's better at Sunset Bakery) where the initial bite tasted sweet when it's a savory bun.  Prices were reasonable.  Their business card has a picture of a wedding cake, which I gather means they make those too.  I would HIGHLY suggest you have a taste test of their cakes before you buy one if their buns are any indication of their baking skills!
author: Ry T.

description: Since this bakery is nearby, I come here often to get some Chinese pastries and bun. Their egg tarts, pineapple bun and cakes are good.  I've ordered birthday cakes for our relatives here. You can just call in early and tell them the time you want to pick up and it will be ready. The fruit in the cake are very fresh too.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
My husband and I are Seniors and we go early every morning. We like the fresh breads, reasonable price, friendly service.  Raisin oat buns and a cup of hot, always fresh coffee.  Good  Vietnamese sandwich with crusty french roll.  Ask for  their  "Old Lady" pastry aka "Wife's Cake"  with a sweet filling in crispy crust.

Cocktail bun and the cream bun are good:  Both are sweet.  Their egg tart is very delicate and light, just sweet enough.
author: Linda J.

description: good bakery yummy snacks and pretty i wish the workers could just speak  little more english though as well as i remember when they first opened there pastries use to be much bigger and cheaper now its a little smaller and price went up but they are veryyy clean which is hard to find for an asian bakery. and there mixed cakes are pretty good. they have lichi fruit it them yum!
author: Thaleda C.
